i â† 1
j â† the number of elements in array C
while j <= j do
    cmp â† i + 1
    exchanged â† False
    while cmp <= j do
        if C[i] dominate C[cmp] then
            swap(C[cmp], C[j])
            j â† j - 1
        else if C[cmp] dominate C[i] then
            swap(C[i], C[cmp])
            swap(C[cmp], C[j])
            j â† j - 1
            cmp â† cmp + 1     // ç»§ç»­èµ°åˆ°åº•ï¼Œäº¤æ¢åˆ°æœ€ä¼˜çš„è§£
            exchanged â† true  // äº¤æ¢äº†è¡¨ç¤ºè¦é‡èµ°ä¸€æ¬¡
        else
            cmp â† cmp + 1
        end if

        if cmp = j and exchanged then  // å¦‚æœåˆ°äº†æœ€åçœ‹æƒ…å†µæ˜¯å¦éœ€è¦é‡å¤
            cmp â† i + 1
            exchanged â† False
        end if
    end while
    i â† i + 1
end while

In parametric methods, pixel colors are assumed to obey a specific distribution, and the distribution parameters are estimated from the pixels in known regions. Alpha values are estimated according to the distance between the color of the unknown pixel and the color distribution of known regions.

For example, if true color samples sembled to the color of an unknown pixel are far from the unknown pixel, the spatial closeness criterion and color criterion will be in conflict. FDMO

ã€ŒFDMOã€çš„ä¸»è¦ä¼˜åŒ–ä¾æ®åœ¨äºï¼Œç»è¿‡ã€ŒMOPã€ç­›é€‰ä¹‹åï¼Œå€™é€‰æ ·æœ¬é›†æ‰€åœ¨çš„ã€ŒPareto Optimal Solutionã€å¾ˆå°å¾ˆå°ã€‚åœ¨ 168,409 ä¸ªå¯è¡Œè§£ä¸­æœ€ååªæœ‰ 11 åœ¨ã€ŒPareto Setã€ä¸­ã€‚

For the foreground sampling MOP defined in Subsection III-A2, the universal set contains 168,409 feasible solutions while only 11 solutions are Pareto optimal in this case.

åœ¨è¿™æ ·çš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹ï¼Œç®—æ³•çš„æ ¸å¿ƒæ€æƒ³å°±æ˜¯åœ¨æ¯ä¸€è¶Ÿéå†ä¸­ï¼ŒæŠŠæ‰€æœ‰è¯¥å‰”é™¤ï¼ˆè¢«æ”¯é…ï¼‰çš„æ ·æœ¬ç»™å‰”é™¤æ‰ã€‚è¿™æ ·å¦‚æœæœ€ç»ˆã€ŒPareto Optimal Solutionã€çš„å¤§å°ä¸º kï¼Œå°±åªéœ€è¦åœ¨ k è¶Ÿéå†ä¸­å®Œæˆç®—æ³•ã€‚è®¾å–æ ·é›†åˆæ€»å¤§å°ä¸º n åˆ™ç®—æ³•çš„æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¸º O(kn) ã€‚

/*
 *  Input: all possible values C.
 *  Output: C, i (the first i âˆ’ 1 elements in array C are Pareto optimal)
 */
i â† 1
j â† the number of elements in array C
while i â‰¤ j do 
    cmp â† i + 1
    while cmp â‰¤ j do
        if C[i] dominate C[cmp] then
            swap(C[cmp], C[j])
            j â† j âˆ’ 1
        else if C[cmp] dominate C[i] then
            swap(C[i], C[cmp])
            swap(C[cmp], C[j])
            j â† j âˆ’ 1
            cmp â† i + 1
        else
            cmp â† cmp + 1
        end if
    end while
    i â† i + 1
end while
return C, i
